question.text: In mice, Y is the dominant allele for yellow fur and y is the recessive allele for grey fur. If Y in the homozygous form leads to death of mice, the result of cross <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>×</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></math> will be:

solution.text:
Since the homozygous condition for Y allele is lethal, the individuals with genotype YY will not survive.

On crossing the parents with genotype Yy, the following progenies are possible.

Yy X Yy
 
  Y y
Y YY 
(Death)		 Yy
(Yellow)
y Yy
(Yellow)		 Yy
(Grey)

YY will give yellow fur but the progeny will not survive.

Yy will give yellow fur as Y is dominant and the progeny will survive since this combination is not lethal.

yy will give grey fur as it is recessive.

Phenotype ratio for the progenies will be 2:1 (2 yellow and 1 grey).
